empty_state.title: Configure a New Key
empty_state.description: A Key object holds a representation of asymmetric keys in various formats.

empty_state_v2.title: Configure your first key
empty_state_v2.group: Keys created in gateways within this group will automatically appear here.
empty_state_v2.description: Keys hold a representation of asymmetric keys that gateways and plugins can use for secure operations.

search.placeholder: Filter by exact name or ID

delete.title: Delete a Key
delete.description: This action cannot be reversed so make sure to check the key usage before deleting.

errors.delete: The key could not be deleted at this time.

key_sets.fetch: Could not fetch available key sets
key_sets.invalid: Please select a valid key set ID

general.title: General Information
general.description: General information will help identify and manage this key.

keys.title: Asymmetric Keys
keys.description: Choose the preferred format for this asymmetric key. Currently only support PEM and JWK format.

id.label: Key ID
id.help: If using JWK, need to match with the jwk.kid field

x5t.label: X.509 Certificate Thumbprint (x5t)
x5t.placeholder: Enter the certificate thumbprint that identifies the key to be used to validate JWT signature
x5t.tooltip: x5t is a base64url-encoded SHA-1 thumbprint of the DER encoding of X.509 certificate
x5t.help: If using x5t, need to match with the jwk.x5t field

name.label: Name
name.placeholder: Enter a unique name for this key
name.tooltip: The name to associate with the given key

tags.label: Tags
tags.placeholder: Enter a list of tags separated by comma
tags.tooltip: An optional set of strings for grouping and filtering, separated by commas.

key_set.label: Key Set
key_set.placeholder: Select a key set to add into
key_set.footer: Search by exact ID to find key sets not included in the list

jwk.label: JWK
jwk.tooltip: A JSON Web key represented as a string

kid.label: Key ID
kid.tooltip: A unique identifier for a key.

set.label: Key Set
set.tooltip: The id (an UUID) of the key-set with which to associate the key.
